phrases: Why do not we play togeth
The days are already getting so short.
Are you sure this is the right way?
So, Granny, why were you out there in the first place?
Really, I cannot thank you enough.
I was not quite sure what I would gotten myself into, to be honest.
I am sorry for all the trouble.
My legs are not what they used to be, you see.
I cannot make it that far into the mountains anymore.
If you had not met her when you did, I just do not know what might have happened.
We may not have much to offer,
but please, at least rest here before you go.
it concerns me that she does not know why she ventured out there.
It is not the first time.
She is been doing it quite a bit lately.
usually when there is a beautiful sunset,
she will say, I am going home, and then she will try to leave.
I have heard that, in rare cases,
people start saying things like that as they get older.
It is almost as though they temporarily regress to their childhood.
Even if not consciously, she may be trying to return to her childhood home.
Well, she and I are both getting on in years, to say the least.
It is only natural that we are starting to show our age.
There you go again, treating me like I have gone senile.
I did not say anything untrue, did I?!
I still work much harder than you, you know.
Why, you cannot even cook rice on your own.
What would you do without me, huh?
Get off your high horse already.
If you hate being called senile so much, then quit acting like it!
Do not raise your voice in front of our guest!
Ah, so you are a mushi-shi?
We used to have one here, remember?
He helped us out when our baby had convulsions and when our rice fields became diseased.
You sure this will make my knee better?
I will treat it again tomorrow morning, and then it should be completely cured.
If someone does not remember her past at all,
is it possible for her to remember her childhood as she gets older?
It is hard to say, without knowing more.
Your wife has no memory of her past?
One day a long time ago, she just suddenly showed up in our village.
It does not usually cross my mind anymore.
I cannot help but wonder what it was all about.
You have not gone home yet?
I am waiting for my dad to get back from the fields first.
Well, make sure you get home before it gets too dark, okay?
Have you seen my daughter, Akane?
None of us ever saw Akane again.
Maybe she is the child of a demon or something.
So you are saying Akane was eaten by a demon?
Before long, Akane's father volunteered to take her in.
you have to feel for the poor girl.
That new girl never comes and plays with us.
You would better quit pretending to be Akane, you hear?
It is not like I want to do this either, you know!
But Dad gave it to me, so what choice do I have?!
Eventually, we accepted Mikage as one of us.
After spending our lives with each other, I was sure that even our bones would be buried together.
But since she started saying, I am going home,
I feel like I cannot be so sure of that anymore.
It is possible that she may remember where she is from one day.
If or when she does, I wonder if she will want to go back there.
At dusk, one person vanishes, and another takes his place...
I have heard of this happening before.
It is sometimes due to an Oomagadoki, or Great Witching Hour mushi,
which only appears in this world at dusk.
A person who has been engulfed by it
will appear at dusk as a shadow without a physical body.
Then, if someone else steps on that shadow or if the shadow steps on them,
that person will trade places with the shadow's owner, becoming engulfed by the Oomagadoki in exchange.
At least, that is the assumption.
those who have appeared in such a manner have no memory of their pasts,
which means there is no real proof.
But then, what happened to Akane after that?
However, it is possible she traded places with someone else in the same way and is living elsewhere.
Cannot you figure out where she may have reappeared?
It is said that the Oomagadoki exists in a different world from ours.
No one can tell when and where our worlds may become connected.
Then I hope Akane's found happiness somewhere too.
Hey, I am bored of this game.
Let us play cat's cradle instead.
Hey, why do not we play shadow tag together?
Thanks to you, my knee's all better.
Come to think of it, there are others in the village who have similar problems with their legs.
Do you think you could see to them as well?
You can stay here another night too, if you would like.
Well then, I think I will take you up on that offer.
Mikage, I am going to go catch some fish for Ginko.
But do not push yourself too hard just because your knee's better.
I will be back by evening, all right?
Something weird just came out of my knee!
But it feels a bit better now...
I got a big catch to
It is nowhere near sunset, though.
You sure she did not just step out for a bit?
Maybe she finally remembered where she is from,
The sun is always setting here.
I bet... this is that shadow's fault.
This is all because that shadow stepped on mine.
Why do not we play togeth
This is all because that shadow stepped on mine.
So you were just going to leave without saying anything?
Do you really want to go home that badly?!
That is not why at all.
From the bottom of my heart, I was so happy.
Meeting Dad and you made me truly happy.
But it should not have been me.
I wanted to trade places with her,
so I stepped on her shadow.
I am so sorry I took Akane from you.
You do not need to apologize to me.
I was happy too, you know.
I have been happy all this time.
And it is thanks to you.
Come now, let us go home.
Let us go back to our home.
It is said that the two lived happily together until she passed.
It is you, is not it, Akane?!
Why are you still in that thing?
You probably could not step on someone else's shadow.
You always were such a gentle, kindhearted girl.
I married the girl who stepped on your shadow.
Do you think I am a terrible person?
Do you hate her, to this day?
Then please, just step on my shadow.
Akane, you have to come back!
